Bulletin 94 Core Principles Review 2016 September 2016 
 
Background 
As part of the 2016 annual review of the Core Principles by the Common Processes Committee, it has been agreed with 
IFQP to make certain changes to clarify the Core Principles, the Core Principles for Throughput Locations and the 
associated Visitor Confidentiality Agreements. 
Summary of main changes:- 
1) IFQP and IFQP Inspectors are now defined terms. 
2) IFQP Inspectors may share inspection reports with member airlines. 
3) IFQP inspection reports shall not contain any Sensitive Information. 
4) IFQP Inspectors will provide the manager of the Operation with a list of IFQP member airlines and the 
Operation's Manager will confirm which of these airlines is served by the Operation. 
5) In the Joint Venture confidentiality agreement the Participants and Throughputters, if applicable, are 
collectively defined as Users. 
6) The document entitled Tier 3 Auditors and Technical Inspectors will be renamed Tier 3 Visitors Confidentiality 
Agreement Joint Ventures. 
7) The term "airline" has been replaced with "customer" (to be consistent with the changes that have been made 
to the Tarbox "customer" definition). 
8) Expanded definitions to improve clarity around: 
* 
the identity of customers 
* 
supply and infrastructure availability

Locations that are in scope for Core Principles or Core Principles for Throughput Locations should have closed the 
action detailed in JIG Bulletin 87 which allows the location to immediately use the latest issue of Core Principle 
documents without the need for further approval by their Board/Management Committee. 
Locations that are in scope for Core Principles should immediately start using the latest Tier 3 Visitors Confidentiality 
Agreement (CP 1.07) for all Visitors (except those who have marketing responsibilities since they shall not be given any 
access to Sensitive Information of any other fuel supplier). Latest version of Aviation Core Principles Appendix (CP 1.03) 
replaces previous versions used with existing Tier 1, 2 and new Tier 3 Confidentiality Agreements. 
Locations that are in scope for Core Principles for Throughput Locations should immediately start using the latest 
Visitors Confidentiality Agreement (CP 1.18) for all Visitors (except those who have marketing responsibilities since they
